page.title: 18LANDSCAPE AND BUILDING
page.content: THE WEST OF THE BLOCK IS URBAN.THE CENTRE AND EAST IS MOSTLY FARMLAND WITH SOME WOODED AREA.THE OLD EAST_WEST RAILWAY RIGHT OF WAY HAS BEEN FILLED IN,IN SOME PLACES TO EXTEND PRIVATE GARDENS AND TO BUILD FACTORIES.DOWDESWELL RESERUOIR HOLDS WATER PUMPED FROM THE RIVER SEVERN.WE SPOTTED GREBES,COOTS,MOORHENS AND MALLARDS.IT IS THE HABITAT OF THE TOAD.A LOT OF NEW HOUSES ARE BEING BUILT IN THE GAPS IN THE URBAN AREA AND WHERE URBAN MEETS COUNTRYSIDE. IN THE SOUTH WEST CORNER THE FORMER LILLEYBROOK HOTEL WENT BANKRUPT AND IS NOW EMPTY AND RUN DOWN.THE LILLYBROOK GOLF CLUB IS THRIVING.IT KEEPS THE COURSE BEAUTIFUL AND HAS PLANTED A WIDE VARIETY OF DECIDUOUS TREES.A RECENT BUILDING IS THE CHARLTON KINGS SECONDARY SCHOOL SPORTS HALL.
